meanings.definition: To surpass in thinking or intelligence.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outthink her opponents in chess.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outthink the tricky puzzle and solve it quickly.
meanings.sent3: Trying to outthink a computer in calculations is like challenging a calculator.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outthink the competition was like a superpower in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to outthink the criminal to solve the case.

meanings.sent1: The clever fox was able to outthink the hunters and escape.
meanings.sent2: He had to outthink his opponents in the game to win.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outthink the mouse, but the mouse was too quick.
meanings.sent4: She had to outthink the tricky riddle to unlock the treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: In order to outthink the enemy, the general devised a brilliant strategy.
